arm_group.arm_group_label: Bilateral Surgical Resection of Carotid Bodies
arm_group.description: Patients undergoing Bilateral Surgical Resection of Carotid Bodies.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary aim of the study is to determine safety, tolerability and feasibility of
      bilateral carotid body resection in patients with systolic heart failure and peripheral
      chemoreceptor hypersensitivity. The secondary aim is to assess potential efficacy of
      bilateral carotid body resection.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bilateral Surgical Resection of Carotid Bodies in Patients With Systolic Heart Failure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  History of heart failure class II-III according to NYHA within at least 6 months
             prior to inclusion

          -  Stable clinical state within at least 4 weeks prior to inclusion

          -  Subject >= 18 years old

          -  Left ventricular ejection fraction ≤ 45% evaluated by transthoracic echocardiography
             (Simpson's method)

          -  Carotid body present in computer cervical angiotomography

          -  History of exacerbated peripheral chemoreceptor sensitivity determined as
             >0.6L/min/%SpO2

          -  Able and willing to give written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unstable angina pectoris, coronary attack, coronary revascularization, exacerbation
             of heart-failure requiring hospitalization, clinically significant infection, surgery
             under general anesthesia within 3 months prior to inclusion

          -  History of stroke, transient ischemic attack (TIA), or clinically significant chronic
             neurological disorder

          -  History of heart transplant

          -  Pregnancy or anticipation of pregnancy

          -  Hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis patients

          -  Obstructive carotid atherosclerotic disease with >50% stenosis

          -  COPD stage III and IV according to GOLD 2007

          -  Unable to perform the spiroergometric assessment

          -  Any significant anomaly in additional investigation which may increase the risk of
             study procedure

intervention.arm_group_label: Bilateral Surgical Resection of Carotid Bodies
intervention.intervention_name: Bilateral Surgical Resection of Carotid Bodies

facility.name: Centrum Chorób Serca - Klinika Kardiologii, 4. Wojskowy Szpital Kliniczny

clinical_study.official_title: Bilateral Surgical Resection of Carotid Bodies in Patients With Systolic Heart Failure

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in peripheral chemosensitivity measured as ventilatory response to hypoxia using transient inhalation of nitrogen at 4 weeks.
Change from baseline in muscle sympathetic nerve activity at 4 weeks.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in exercise tolerance (peak oxygen consumption, slope relating minute ventilation to carbon dioxide production, oxygen uptake efficiency slope, time of exercise, 6-minute walking test distance, New York Heart Association Class) at 4 weeks.
Change from baseline in quality of life (Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire, visual analog scale) at 4 weeks.
Change from baseline in serum concentration of NT-proBNP at 4 weeks.
Change from baseline in barosensitivity at 4 weeks.
Change from baseline in peripheral chemosensitivity measured as ventilatory response to hypoxia using transient inhalation of nitrogen at 8 weeks.
Change from baseline in muscle sympathetic nerve activity at 8 weeks.

Change from baseline in exercise tolerance (peak oxygen consumption, slope relating minute ventilation to carbon dioxide production, oxygen uptake efficiency slope, time of exercise, 6-minute walking test, New York Heart Association Class) at 8 weeks.

Change from baseline in sleep pattern in PSG (apnoea-hypopnoea index, percentage of central and obstructive episodes, average oxygen saturation, number of arousals, average duration of apnoeic and hypopnoeic episodes) at 8 weeks.
Change from baseline in quality of life (Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire, visual analog scale) at 8 weeks.
Change from baseline in heart function and morphology (transthoracic echocardiography) at 8 weeks.
Change from baseline in serum concentration of NT-proBNP at 8 weeks.
Change from baseline in barosensitivity at 8 weeks.
Change from baseline in arrhythmia burden (24 hour ECG tape) at 8 weeks.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
